description:

title: 'Nova-metadata-api crash when you configure a hostname instead of ip in nova.conf'

comments.content:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~grobles89

comments.content: Can you explain which config variable you want to set to a hostname and why? I tend to think that nova works as designed currently, so this would become a wishlist bug to change the intended behaviour.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~j-harbott

comments.content:
The problem is in the nova metadata api, when you configure in nova.conf an fqdn in metadata_host variable that api crashes. For example if you put 127.0.0.1 it works perfectly but putting localhost the api will crash with the following error:

netaddr.core.AddrFormatError: failed to detect a valid IP address from 'localhost'

This is because the netaddr module of python imported on nova/network/linux_net.py does not support a FQDN, but supports IP address.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~grobles89

comments.content: IMO, this is a wishlist item and, due to nova-nets impending deprecation, one that is unnecessary.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stephenfinucane
